WRITING.TEXT: Hmm always wondered myself about those date codes and tyre evolution - are there any 'average' type tyres that you found changed significantly over time? Ie. not slicks/track tyres. I've heard on the grapevine that the old Bridgestone RE050s changed a lot since they were an OEM tyre on plenty of cars but I have no sources to back it up.

Oh and don't go by what an owner may claim. Most owners will not know about a car's issues unless they actively work on it themselves, especially with these types of cars. I've looked at so many cars with so called full service histories, and they are sometimes worse than those with no history at all.

It would be a Liberty not a Legacy. I would not by any means take out a loan for this car. Can almost guarantee something will break and you will not be able to afford it unless you do the work yourself (in which case yes, it can be very cheap to run and maintain).
$5,500 is also way too much for a Gen 3 even if it is that clean. You can easily buy a Gen 4 for that much, I almost sold mine for a touch more and it's ridiculously clean compared to the average Gen 4.
As someone with 2 Libertys and someone also looking to buy another one, I would never buy a Gen 3 for that much unless it was a clean B4 (even then it would not be an easy yes).
Probably unlikely, I'd imagine those would have been out yonks ago if they were around. Maybe some day...

WRITING.TITLE: Tame Impala - Love/Paranoia

WRITING.TEXT:
Just had a similar issue myself. TPG was quick to send their own technician to check the lines and I got the all clear on my end, they blamed Telstra (issue outside the premises). Telstra was a mess to deal with but eventually admitted fault on their end (just this morning, after about a month of complaints).
Check your home phone connection, assuming you have one. Mine was dropping out every day from around 9AM to 5PM, sometimes taking the DSL connection along with it, or slowing it to a standstill. There was also a lot of noise on the line when it was connected. Do what others have said here to check your own end before going elsewhere.

It's like they make it intentionally grindy and inconvenient to make money normally so you're pressured into buying shark cards which in themself are poor value unless they are on sale.
I truly believe they make this game extremely frustrating like this on purpose. It feels like every legitimate money making method on this game is somehow subdued and attached to some time limit instead so that you're forced to grind for hours regardless of how efficient you are. Example: mission (un)replayability, crate or vehicle buy/sell timers. What on earth is the purpose of this other than to simply stop you making money? I'd like to think people could make so much more legitimate money if these artificial and unnecessary timers were history. If people want to be super efficient just let them... but of course that wouldn't sell cards would it.

Did a few just before with a friend, and the money got split between us, but he didn't even receive it and I only got 100k of the potential 200k. It was just completely lost for some reason. Either it's broken or there's something else at play.
They also fit perfectly in the centre storage section (just below the gear stick) on the pre-FL, I always have a pack sitting there.

Have you considered Pilot Sport 3s? Or are you referring to all the MPS series in general? I feel as if people only know about PSS and often overlook the little brother. In my size they were one of the cheapest tyres available too. That said, the PS3 is slowly being replaced by PS4 but this might allow for some price drops if they're being phased out.
Hopefully I can finally sort this massive mess out. http://i.imgur.com/VETTXyq.png
You are an absolute legend. Will be sure to give full credit if I get around to actually uploading or finishing mine.
This is fantastic, well done! Neat video too.

Hey, not OP here but I also was working on an Apoc 'cover' some time ago but never got around to properly finishing it because the percussion in general was pretty pathetic - it sounds pretty horrible and takes way too long to translate into sheet music since it was all made in Guitar Pro (yes I realise you're not supposed to create music in this). The last bit of progress on it was a few months ago: https://soundcloud.com/turbolag/tame-impala-apocalypse-dreams-unfinished
Just wondering if I could use your drum track as well? Will give you full credit there of course! Your cover is fantastic too, I like how it isn't just a full copy of the song which is what I was going for.

I've found the same thing. A lot of them were expecting for the course to be around half-half with locals and internationals, and they too are disappointed. They're mostly super nice and of course there's a few outliers - but that goes for just about any set of people. Honestly I find myself feeling a lot more comfortable around them compared to some of the typical locals (since I'm of Asian background).
Masters of Accounting.

Yep - I'm not blaming the students one bit. It's the uni who decided to take them in after "knowing" their language skills (after assessing their IELTS I presume). It puts a lot of strain on the one who is most competent at their language. I honestly believe I'd be better off working alone without them since they're more of a net drain, just because I spend so much time correcting them, and like you, I don't want my grades dragged down. I too have no idea how they pass exams; however some seem to be absolutely amazing at rote learning, major props to them since it's something I sure as hell wouldn't be able to do. I go out of my way to "teach" English to the few that really do want to learn, since I can tell they are genuinely interested in understanding more of the language here. After talking to a few of them, they claim that they're fairly displeased that they don't get to interact with many more locals, and that it's basically just like attending a uni in their own country (although this is anecdotal).
The university basically relies on the fact that no locals will enter this course and see what's really going on - and the few that attempt it may be driven away due to the high concentrations of non-locals simly due to the fact that you will have nobody to talk to or do proper work with.

65-70% + 15-20%? Lucky. I'm about 1 in 240 at my course at Monash. It's basically assumed that everyone in the course is Chinese, and people generally assume that you can speak it too (I couldn't really look further different). Of course there's a few others mixed in, a few Malaysian and a tiny percentage Singaporean, but I'd put it at around 80% Chinese. It doesn't bother me one bit where they come from but it's rather difficult to deal with when they can't communicate and you're thrown in with them for 30%-weighted assignments. There's no doubt that a significant amount would fail English at a high school level, in fact I wouldn't be surprised if some were at, or below a primary school level. To them, as long as their IELTS score is above some threshold, they're perfectly good at English. There's a few that honestly do try though, and they all tend to flock around me since I'm apparently their personal English tutor now. That said, at least they're trying, unlike most.
I've come across some that couldn't put a single coherent sentence together - but I managed to kick one out of my group and I honestly hope they fail him considering how horrible his language skills were. What's more pathetic however is the English level of the people working internally. I received this 'feedback' a little while ago.
"Excellent work indeed. The student shows that he has the very strong command in using accounting and economics information to conduct the financial analysis in the fundamental level. The work is written in a very professional manner and well presented. The student also demonstrate that he put lots of efforts in predicting the firms' future performance on his own."
Wonder how many times Google Translate was used here. Just like all the work submitted to them.
I suppose this is what happens when the unis get a tad greedy. The internationals are paying some 4.4k per subject as opposed to 1.3k for the locals so it's rather obvious what's driving it.
Oh and by the way, this isn't even at an under-grad level... this is Masters.
I see, thank you! The IBIS might be the way to go at such short notice I suppose, but I will check the campus rooms too just in case.

WRITING.TEXT:

I've bought and sold quite a few things on it, and I've never had any issues simply due to my attitude towards it. You will get a lot of messages with ridiculous low-balling (like 25% of the price), and a lot telling you their life stories and why you should give it to them for free or something. It's as simple as saying a big no to them. I usually put my price up a tiny bit to let people negotiate (as just about everyone has done), but if it sells at my asking price, so be it. Like others have said, I'm one of those people that will not hold an item. If you want it, make some time and come to get it, unless you're willing to put down a deposit.
The next reason may be that your ads simply aren't descriptive enough. Most ads I see are extremely vague and don't say too much, so of course I will ask if it's "still available" simply because I don't trust the seller enough to actually remove an item since they can't even be bothered typing an ad.
It's this sort of shit that drives me insane and will leave people hanging dry.

No doubt it's reliable though, in that sense yes, it is definitely a good transmisison.

I find the SPORT mode completely useless. If I want to go quick I'll do it myself, thank you. The sequential is good, I find myself shifting much more intuitively and smoother than what the car can manage anyway. Have nearly exactly the same car but a model year earlier (I think equivalent to US model though). The main problem I'd look out for is headgaskets and oil leaks (specifically into where the sparks sit). It would be hard to check, and many mechanics won't be able to tell if there's anything wrong without opening it up or at least checking the sparks. The issues seem to be very common and most of the cars only ever suffer from the same problems, I've never heard of other major issues with them.
Just FYI the 4EAT is pretty horrible for day to day use (IMO). The only way I drive it is using the 'sequential'. That said, it works decently well in the twisties even though it may not seem like it.
Ask /r/subaru for better advice.

I go with whatever feels right. I have Michelin PS3s, and the tyre shop filled them to 40psi. After doing quite a bit of spirited, city, and highway driving, I've found that I can go down to about 34psi for spirited which "appears" to help cornering, and up to around 39 for highway. I've done absolutely 0 quantitative tests and I'm only going by feel, but I can feel some difference from low (31) to high (40), only in hard cornering. I am simply assuming higher is better for milage so I pump them up for longer trips.

WRITING.TITLE: Saw a post here about Meguiars Scratch-X 2.0 recently, so I decided to try it for myself on my tired paint.
WRITING.TEXT:
It came out pretty nice for the small amount of money, it doesn't remove the deep scratches or etchings but does work well on swirls and random patches. I wasn't expecting much at all but I'm impressed that it did anything, it's good for little isolated parts of panels, but it would take absolutely ages to do any significant part of the car (by hand, that is). I applied it with a small foam application pad. It takes a lot of effort to rub the product in and it sucks doing it in the heat (as expected with hand application).
http://imgur.com/a/U6CfT

Anyone on here: http://www.detailparadise.com.au/forum.php
Depends on what you want to get done, $350 probably won't be enough for a properly done polish. The only way you'll probably find this is if you go to one of those generic "detail" shops which probably won't do a very good job. As someone commented before, try Obsession Detailing, he knows his stuff very well and charges very reasonable prices. If you just want a wash + wax/seal + basic interior clean you can probably find it for a lot less.
Same! Also want to know how it performs.

I have been using OCW as my spray for some 3 years now. This http://www.motorgeek.co.uk/db_images/OptimumCarWax1.jpg bottle has lasted me the entire time with fairly regular usage. It's very easy to use and is quite idiot proof in application. It also seems to last for a fairly long time as far as I can tell, however I still add some more at least every month. I know you're not supposed to, but I also use it on my plastic interior trim as it leaves a nice smell.
My only complaint is that it can get very streaky if there's any extra content left behind.

I find Gumtree fine, you will get heaps of low-ballers but I've personally never come across any 'scammy' looking people. I've recently sold a few things within the range of $100 and bought something for nearly 1k and every person I've come across has been genuine and fine to deal with. That said, I detail my ads as much as possible so the buyer knows exactly what to expect, plus I include heaps of photos and try to reply ASAP. The same cannot be said for the ads I am interested in. It's usually easy enough to tell if someones genuine simply by their manner of communicating. Use common sense and you will be fine.

WRITING.TITLE: Finally a sunny day in Melbourne, so I took the opportunity for a quick wash and drive!

WRITING.TEXT: Good luck peeps

Is there any quantifiable evidence to show that shorter suspension leads to better handling in game? Does this "better handling" lead to the car actually being faster around corners or bumps? Does it also affect the spring rates?

Not right at the moment since the place is still easily controllable by the two of us, but we may need some more later on. We'll definitely be sure to make it known when we do need applicants. Additionally, we still need to sort out how we'd select people.

Has any testing actually been done to see if it makes a difference? I usually just buy what looks good because honestly I have never noticed any performance impact. Maybe there's some minute difference like off-road tyres where they're better over curbs or something?

I suppose I don't really have *a* 'favourite' as such but my most driven vehicle would be the Comet. The only reason I drive it so much is because it's ridiculously fun and IIRC the only rear engined sports car in the game. It also sounds pretty decent and not everyone online tends to have one.

I agree with what you think it was intended for. The vehicle is made for the offroad paths but not really the rock-crawling aim that most people thought it was for. That said, I tend to use my normal (non-armoured) Kuruma or Sultan for these types of paths. The ground clearance doesn't really come in too handy for the intention and only really aids during the "rock crawling" type off roading.

This makes me wonder why content keeps coming yet the game performance keeps dropping. I've always had this theory that some of the "DLC" is just either unfinished or previously finished things that they've had lying around that they keep releasing to make people think they're still working on the game. I.e. they only ever released 75% of the game but they've always had some 90~ complete.

most of them are design decisions, not things that don't work as intended
You're right I think. So unfortunate that they chose this route. I would even go as far as arguing that the game performance hit may have been chosen as a method to stop the cheating online, but they didn't realise how much of a performance hit there would be. Of course this is just speculation, but knowing R* I wouldn't be surprised.

Recorded and uploaded, with music cut off.
http://youtu.be/2IJyvLkLAHY

It's starting right now!
I'll try and record with Audacity and leave it running.
Listening in now, hope there's some interesting conversation. Thanks for the heads up.

As much as I agree with R* is dedicated to their game, their actions seem like sometimes they're very clumsy making it seem otherwise. Considering the changes they have made up to date, it looks like they are continuously adding more content but ignoring support for the foundations of the game itself (eg. matchmaking, performance issues, game launch issues). What it indicates (in my opinion) is that while they do care, they just seem to be bandaging all the issues and expecting their code to be a workaround rather than finding the source of the issues and fixing that instead.
It almost feels like R* is a few different companies all working in different directions, and that they are not focussed in fixing the game but rather adding content and expecting people to be satisfied with it. After all, the game only broke after adding new content, it was otherwise fine. I wonder how this will all work in the long term, especially when R* decides to end support for the game. On top of this, what does this imply about the long term playability of online? Will the game keep breaking as more updates are released?

Hopefully the new sub will prevent any clearly manipulated posts from slipping through the cracks since it will be run by impartial moderators. We'll try our best!
Cheers!

WRITING.TITLE: Regarding the current state of GTA's PC performance: Is it realistic to ever expect the game to run as intended?
WRITING.TEXT:
**Regarding the current state of GTA's PC performance: Is it realistic to ever expect the game to run as intended?**
As many of you may be aware, the latest IGG patches have demolished some player's PC performances. Personally I have experienced the PS3 version of the game running very poorly too, to a point where simply driving a car at full speed will make the game not render any objects or the map itself. In the long term with new content being constantly added, will there ever be a point in time where the game will run smoothly on all platforms? It seems like it isn't in R*'s interest as they have already received money for the game. Have there been any other games that have had similar issues? How have they been handled?
Let's do this. Finally we'll have a place for no garbage posts. You can create the sub and mod me? Or should I do so?

Apoc Dreams by a very long way. Preferably with the live ending too.

WRITING.TITLE: Constantly crashing during heists
WRITING.TEXT:
My game is constantly crashing during heists and setups. It sometimes happens in exactly the same spots but other time just seems to fail randomly. I have only crashed once during free roam (started today) and never crashed during a normal mission (non heist). What usually happens is the game will simply freeze for a moment, then the screen will go completely white and the normal Windows "Program has stopped working" screen is showen. Alternatively, the pause menu will be endlessly showing the spinning symbol and phone will not pop up. Sometimes I can play for hours on end without a single crash and other times I can't be in a game for more than a minute. Albeit rarely, sometimes the game will cause a BSOD as well.
I'm running the retail DVD edition of the game (on the latest patch) and on the latest 2.4.1.21 Nvidia drivers too. The crashes have been happening since day 1 and no driver or patch has stopped the crashes.
My PC specs are as follows:
Part | Model ---|--- CPU | i7 870 Mobo | Gigabyte P55A-UD3-DS3L RAM | Corsair XMS3 (4x2GB) CMX4GX3M2A1600C9 GPU | Gainward Nvidia GTX 960 SSD | Transcend SSD370 256GB OS | W7 Home Premium 64bit PSU | Antec EarthWatts 750W

WRITING.TITLE: A few site suggestions
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm not sure of the feasibility of implementing these features into the site, but they might be good for some inspiration at least.
1. An ability to lock the window onto any part of the song. It is rather annoying when working on the very end of a very long piece and having the window attempt to scroll back to the start. Having the window auto-scroll with the play bar also takes a toll on the playback speed.
2. Ability to select only certain instruments. The current selection tool is simple and easy to use and I think should remain, but it would be nice if it allowed you to select only instruments of your choice. In conjunction with this, a way to replace these selected instruments with others.
3. In addition to the copy/paste function, a clipboard to store maybe the last few things you copied. The current copy/paste method relies on dragging and dropping, and does not work correctly when moving large sections of a piece. It could be placed in the free space in the side bar [here with the same layout as the links above.](http://i.gyazo.com/7d8652f7c9f04753964c2e62cacd124f.png)
4. Viewable statistics of a sequence. Eg. amount of notes, time length. Not really necessary but would be neat.
Why not? :)

WRITING.TEXT: Polyphony Digital

Firstly, I'm glad to see you and PD starting to go a little more public and open up to the community.
As a long term, avid player of the GT series, I have noticed that there have been reiterative new additions of features to each of the games such as B-Spec mode, course creators and photomode. Are you currently looking into more innovative content such as this to add to GT6/7? (eg. a drag racing mode)
Do you ever think car customisation will become more prevalent in future GT games? I felt that GT has been going somewhat backwards in terms of cars themselves but forward in terms of driving. I personally loved the racing modifications on GT2 and loved turning family sedans into race cars. On top of visual modifications, performance modifications also seem to have been more packaged together unlike in older GT games. I feel as if this has taken away some of the immersion of the older games where you started poor and built up your cars using cheap parts along the career mode. Is there a possibility in future GT games that this will return? Or is the playerbase generally looking for a quicker way to modify their cars?
GT appears to be heading towards actual racing with race-prepped cars and moving away from more 'normal' road cars. Is the game heading towards an emphasis of actual racing cars and less towards road cars?
Are there any plans on bringing back shuffle racing (such as in GT5) to GT6/7? I know for a fact that this is something the community misses.
Do you and/or PD actively listen to communities and fanbases such as GTPlanet for inspiration or do
you have a-set-in-stone vision for future updates and general advancement of the series?
And one personally, what is your favourite car and track combo on GT6?
Finally, thank you for creating GT. It really helped ignite my love of cars and is collectively my most played game series.
Keeps most people away... more space left for us. Not complaining haha

4.4k is ridiculous money to spend on a 2.5 N/A Gen 3 IMHO. Back when I was searching for a Gen 3, I could've picked one up in reasonable condition for about 5k (manual) with around 200ks on the clock. At that kind of cost, I would probably just find a new engine with less usage on it and drop that in.

I personally don't find rev-matching impossible with the 2.5i, infact I do it very frequently and it makes driving a lot smoother in general, whether or not I'm driving quickly. Heel-toeing isn't any more difficult but of course, I don't do this very often compared to simple rev-matching. I haven't driven an older car quickly before but since I'm used to driving "newer" cars, I absolutely don't find it that difficult at all. That said, DBW sucks and it makes the car feel sluggish and makes you have less confidence when driving, but I've heard a good tune can solve that.
Speaking of which, I recently drove a 2011 WRX and for once, I really felt glad getting back into my much slower car, since it felt a lot nicer to drive in my opinion. The WRX felt 'too big' to me, but I guess that's just because again, I'm used to an older car that like you have stated, feels much more "fun" to drive. No doubt the WRX isn't quick though, brilliant car for what its meant to be.

I honestly don't think you can properly 'learn to drive' with just 50 hours (as you say). However, you probably can pass a test with a lot less since it's way too easy, and if you're doing it in an auto, and can't pass, then of course, I don't think you deserve a licence at all. If you just want a licence, I'm sure you can get away with 50, but I really wouldn't advise this at all. I had to do my 120 hours, but I ended up completing them in just over a month and must've clocked up around 1000 at least before I sat my test. I still learn things on the road every time I drive on my Ps, so just doing 50 hours is definitely not the end of learning.
Maybe what you should do is, simply learn to pass your test (which is easy), then get your Ps, and *then* learn to drive on your own.
$40 an hour certainly doesn't sound too bad, an instructor I used charged $60 an hour and this seems to be the standard rate in my area for all instructors.
Surely there are a few deserted or mostly unused back streets in your area? How about an unused carpark? I don't think you necessarily need a paddock or a field. Do you need a fully licensed driver if you're in a completely deserted carpark in the middle of nowhere?
I find it extremely unfortunate that for those of you that actually follow the rules (such as OP) and want to learn to actually drive struggle to find someone to take them driving. A lot of people I know just faked their hours and are now driving on the roads, which *sucks*.

Nice, is it an auto or manual?

You can't get more power from it (that's very noticeable anyway) unless you go with forced induction, where supercharging is somewhat getting popular over here in Aus. It's a fairly long process and costs a lot. You'd be better off selling and getting a car that's already turbocharged from the factory.

I'm assuming you're also from Aus since you want a Liberty. I don't know if you're on your Ps or whatever, but remember that you can't get a turbo'd Suby at all if you are (unless you're from SA or something).

I have a Liberty 2.5i 08' 4EAT (Yeah the auto sucks) as my first proper car. As much as I initially regret not purchasing a 6 cyl model, the 2.5 is plentiful for a new driver. Sometimes you just need to rev it a little harder to get it going but it's also kind of fun doing that too. The only main let down is the 4EAT which absolutely sucks in normal auto, so I only ever drive in sequential (what's worse is that I have a manual licence).
Just get an N/A Subaru, there's really nothing wrong with the power/torque for a new driver. I imagined the car to be underpowered but it's certainly got enough to have some fun with. Plus, it's the handling of the Lib that impresses me, just stay away from the autos unless they have some sort of manual shiftability.

I don't personally remodel vehicles, sorry if I was unclear. I simply edit the physics and sometimes models/textures, sounds etc until I'm happy with the cars. Most road cars (other than the Supra) have terrible physics, so I usually tinker with them. I've sent you a PM with some links.

I've found that most rF mods are terrible physics-wise (at least from my perspective). If you want good physics without a hassle, I wouldn't recommend rF as you're going to have to try a lot of mods until you find something you like. There's only a few mods I personally drive without editing myself, being WSC70, HistorX, DRM and FIA GT3 2010.
However, rF is a fantastic base game to mod with, and it's really a sandbox once you know what you're doing. I usually just use other people's converted models (mostly road cars) and re-do the physics myself to my own liking until I make something I enjoy. Rinse, and repeat.

Seriously you don't need to be studying all the time if you go to the school. The people who get in are still completely normal human beings, lol. Some will study, some simply won't. Don't think of it as some sort of competition, only the entrance exam is.

I was in an ALP type thing too but only for maths (the school only had that). If you got in (or anyone else for that matter), you'll probably be just fine with the rest of the group who also enter Mac Rob. I would say to just do it, it'll provide you with a lot of different experiences and you don't need to lose contact with your old friends. It might help if you have starting ground in the form of other friends entering from your school too however, if not, it may seem a little daunting at first. Within the first week, you'll be completely fine.

I wanted to go instantly from my place. I left with no regrets as I didn't fit in at my old school even though it was a decent place. If you are seriously contemplating staying, accept the Mac Rob offer, then negotiate with your current school that you will stay with benefits. The school will not want to lose you as you will push their results up. I'm fairly sure you can decline the Mac Rob offer quite easily as there are people waiting to get in. Did you get in to a Yr. 10 or 11 entry or into Yr. 9?
I don't think Balwyn would be considered far at all, I know some people who used to come to mine all the way from Sunbury each day..

I go to MHS, basically the equivalent boys school, I certainly don't regret going to it, and it was a fairly large change from a decent Catholic school. You won't regret it as long as you expect what's to come. Just a word of warning, the people there are usually a completely different demographic to what you may find in a more.. 'ordinary' school.
